doc.after: Confederate Colonel John Pemberton who was wounded in the Civil War, became addicted to morphine, and began a quest to find a substitute for the dangerous opiate.[7] The prototype Coca-Cola recipe was formulated at Pemberton's Eagle Drug and Chemical House,[8] a drugstore in Columbus, Georgia, originally as a coca wine.[9][10] He may have been inspired by the formidable success of Vin Mariani, a European coca wine.[11]
